intro: Turraea octandra, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by oval-shaped capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas and is valued for its timber and medicinal properties.
